channel.title: Url Doesn't Work
channel.description: Hey Guys, Mhmm When I Added The Url [link] For Vote And For The Forums on my source... Didn't Work When I Wrote ::vote Or ::forums Ingame ... Any Feedbacks How I Can Make Those Url[links] Work? Please Help !

item.title: Url Doesn't Work
item.dc:creator: @Sol0 Sol0
item.description:
@Sol0 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:39, topic:509040”][quote author=Sol0 link=topic=627280.msg4263466#msg4263466 date=1363702646]

public static final String FORUMS = "www.realnex.forumotion.com";

public static final String VOTE4CASH = "www.realnex.uphero.com/vote.php";

Should work…

Bro It Worked But When Other Players Do The Commands ::vote4cash or ::forums, It Opens From Me !!! Not From Them… But When I Write ::Forums Or ::vote4cash … It Opens From Me !! GOT IT ?
[/quote]

I understand that, I meant the original commands were calling those 2 strings. The 2 strings had http:// in them, which isn’t supposed to be there - www. is supposed to be there.[/quote]
Bro… Its Already With " Www. "

Read full topic

I understand that, I meant the original commands were calling those 2 strings. The 2 strings had http:// in them, which isn’t supposed to be there - www. is supposed to be there.

item.title: Url Doesn't Work
item.dc:creator: @Sol0 Sol0
item.description:
@Sol0 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:27, topic:509040”][quote author=Sol0 link=topic=627280.msg4262990#msg4262990 date=1363635036]

Delete this line:
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null,“Loading…”);

deleted it… and i still have another error

Replace the command with this:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("openforums")) {//Jk lol. try { JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null,"Loading.."); String url = Config.FORUMS; java.awt.Desktop.getDesktop().browse(java.net.URI. create(url)); } catch(IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }

Don’t forget to import JOptionPane and IOException.
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;
import java.io.IOException;

client.Java ?
in
[/quote]

The command goes in Commands.java and the imports go at the top of the class with the rest of the imports.[/quote]

[quote=“Sup22211, post:31, topic:509040”][quote author=Lirimoo link=topic=627280.msg4262996#msg4262996 date=1363635294]

if (playerCommand.startsWith("forums")) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("http://realnex.forumotion.com/", 12000); c.sendMessage("Loading..."); }

if (playerCommand.startsWith("vote")) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("http://realnex.uphero.com/vote.php", 12000); c.sendMessage("Loading..."); }

No problem.
[/quote]
WHAT NO PROBLEM HE SAID HE GOT AN ERROR WITH THIS CODE ^ ^ ^ ^ ^ ALL YOU DID IS ADDED (“LOADING…”) SERIOUS?[/quote]

i edited something but i got this again

item.title: Url Doesn't Work
item.dc:creator: @Sol0 Sol0
item.description:
@Sol0 wrote:

Sup22211:

Does it works?

Got Error

[quote=“Fridder, post:16, topic:509040”]Did you save, compile and restart the server?

Open PlayerAssistant and change your sendFrame126 method with mine:

public void sendFrame126(String s, int id) { synchronized(c) { if(c.getOutStream() != null && c != null ) { c.getOutStream().createFrameVarSizeWord(126); c.getOutStream().writeString(s); c.getOutStream().writeWordA(id); c.getOutStream().endFrameVarSizeWord(); c.flushOutStream(); } } } [/quote]
Same As Mine ^ !!

Read full topic

item.title: Url Doesn't Work
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Did you save, compile and restart the server?

Open PlayerAssistant and change your sendFrame126 method with mine:

	public void sendFrame126(String s, int id) {
		synchronized(c) {
			if(c.getOutStream() != null && c != null ) {
				c.getOutStream().createFrameVarSizeWord(126);
				c.getOutStream().writeString(s);
				c.getOutStream().writeWordA(id);
				c.getOutStream().endFrameVarSizeWord();
				c.flushOutStream();
			}
		}
	}

Read full topic
